thread.title: "SHETHER" Is "The Most Disrespectful Record" Ever, Says Nicki Minaj's Ex Safaree
thread.title_full: "SHETHER" Is "The Most Disrespectful Record" Ever, Says Nicki Minaj's Ex Safaree

author: Danielle Harling
title: "SHETHER" Is "The Most Disrespectful Record" Ever, Says Nicki Minaj's Ex Safaree
text:
"SHETHER" Is "The Most Disrespectful Record" Ever, Says Nicki Minaj's Ex Safaree February 28, 2017 | 8:55 AM 13 
The disrespect on Remy Ma’s “SHETHER” is too real, according to Nicki Minaj’s ex, Safaree Samuels . 
While speaking with TMZ this week, Safaree was asked if “SHETHER” has the ability to harm Nicki’s street cred. In response, Nicki’s ex referred to the potency of the diss track. 
“It’s just a very disrespectful record,” Safaree said. “It’s probably the most disrespectful record I’ve ever heard in my life. That shit is very out of pocket.” 
When asked if Nicki should respond to Remy, Safaree didn’t seem terribly confident in the Jamaica, Queens MC’s ability to issue a worthy response. 
“I don’t know. ‘Cause it’s like what can you even say … What can you even say to Remy? It’s really not much,” he said. 
In regards to providing backup for his former boo, Safaree says he’s good. 
“I don’t get caught up in the whole female beef thing. I’mma just try to mind my business as much as possible,” Safaree said when asked if he’ll provide Nicki with any assistance. A post shared by Safaree 🇯🇲 (@iamsafaree) on Feb 25, 2017 at 1:47pm PST 
Based on the lyrical content of “SHETHER,” many were quick to assume that either Safaree or Meek Mill provided Remy with intel for the song. 
In fact, while speaking about his shady namedrop on “SHETHER” yesterday (February 27) on Hot 97, Ebro Darden speculated that Safaree was “possibly” the culprit due to what he claimed was prior jealousy.
